config.info: This command allows you to manage the application configuration settings and settings profiles.

ls.flag_all: List all settings (default current profile), including internal settings
ls.flag_prefix: Display settings with a specific prefix

get.description: Get a setting or option value
get.flag_secret: Prompts to enter Secrets password to display value. If password is not set it prints secret value instead <redacted> without the prompt

add.description: Add given value to setting value

remove.description: Remove given value from setting value

reset.description: Reset a setting to its default value

i18n.info: This command allows you to manage and translate application strings.

report.flag_threshold: Exit with code 1 if any language has lower than threshold percentage
report.flag_lang: Display report for a specific language only
report.flag_without_deps: Exclude dependency translations (show only current project translations)

list.flag_lang: Display list for a specific language only
list.flag_missing: Display only keys with missing translations
list.flag_json: Output JSON response instead of table
list.flag_without_deps: Exclude dependency translations (show only current project translations)

flags.help: display help or help for the command. [...command --help]
flags.show_exec: the -x flag prints all the cli commands as they are executed.
flags.system_debug: enable system debug log level (very verbose)
flags.x_prod: DEV ONLY: force app into production mode setting app_is_devel false when running from source.
